intro: Erechtites wairauensis, commonly known as the Wairau erecthites, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. Erechtites wairauensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing nectar for native pollinators.
